intro: Oldenlandia rigidula, commonly known as rigid whipcord, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Pacific. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, wiry stems and small, white or yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a rough, hairy texture. Oldenlandia rigidula is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and dry forests, where it thrives in full sun.
